DOC.brief_title: Assessment Chiropractic Treatment Using Reaction Response Times Members Special Operation Forces ( ACT2 )
DOC.detailed_description: The Assessment Chiropractic Treatment 2 ( ACT2 ) assess change reaction/response time follow Chiropractic Manipulative Therapy ( CMT ) use randomize controlled trial member SFQ SOAR . This population face simultaneous physiological cognitive demand . The ability give accurate appropriate motor response short time require successful completion type mission expect undertake . DOC.criteria: Age range least 20 year age Written inform consent Active duty SFQ personnel Special Operation Forces part 160th SOAR regiment flight status station Ft. Campbell , KY military site Pain Intensity ( NIH 's PROMIS question # 29 ) > 4 Initial Visit Additional diagnostic procedure need ( e.g . xray ) Bone joint pathology contraindication CMT . Potential participant recent spinal fracture , concurrent spinal paraspinal tumor ( ) , spinal paraspinal infection ( ) , inflammatory arthropathy significant osteoporosis refer appropriate care . Other contraindication CMT ( i.e. , unstable spinal segment , cauda equina syndrome ) Currently treat traumatic brain injury ( TBI ) Reasonable chance within 24 week initial participation may unable complete study , i.e. , deployment , receive order distant duty assignment train site otherwise absent current military site study participation period . Received care Doctor Chiropractic within past 30 day . Pregnant plan become pregnant within 4 week .
